word: Paul writes to the Romans, \93If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceably with all men.\94 But there is a point beyond which it is impossible to maintain union and harmony without the sacrifice of principle. Separation then becomes an absolute duty. The laws of nations should be respected when they do not conflict with the laws of God. But when there is collision between them, every true disciple of Christ will say, as did the apostle Peter when commanded to speak no more in the name of Jesus, \93We ought to obey God rather than men.\94Manuscript 51, 1899 (see also Signs of the Times, Nov. 8, 1899).
